title: Structure: Self Introduction
modelText: Hi! My name is Maria. I am from Spain. I live in Madrid. I am 25 years old. I am a student.
prompt: Write a similar text introducing yourself using the structure provided.

analysis.explanation: Use this phrase to state your name.
Use this to say your country of origin.
Use this to specify your current city.
Always use 'I am' for age, not 'I have'.

title: Structure: Simple Email
modelText:
Hi John,

I hope you are well. I am writing to invite you to my birthday party on Saturday. It starts at 8 PM at my house. Please let me know if you can come.

Best,
Sarah
prompt: Write an email inviting a friend to a movie night.

analysis.explanation: A standard friendly opening phrase.
Clear way to state the purpose of the email.
Use this to specify the time of an event.
Polite way to ask for a response or RSVP.

title: Structure: Narrative
modelText: Last summer, I went to Paris. At first, I was nervous because I didn't speak French. However, everyone was very friendly. Unexpectedly, I met an old friend at a cafe. In the end, it was the best trip of my life.
prompt: Write a story about a memorable trip you took.

analysis.explanation: Set the scene with a time reference.
Use this connector to describe the beginning of the situation.
Use this to introduce a contrast or change.
Good connector to wrap up the story.

title: Structure: Product Review
modelText: I recently bought the new X-Phone. Although it is expensive, the camera is outstanding. One downside is the battery life. On the other hand, the screen is beautiful. Overall, I would recommend it to photography lovers.
prompt: Write a review of a device or gadget you own.

analysis.explanation: Use 'Although' to introduce a concession.
Useful phrase to introduce a negative point politey.
Classic connector to show the opposing (positive) view.
Standard phrase for the final verdict.

title: Structure: Opinion Essay
modelText: It is often argued that technology disconnects us. To a certain extent, this is true. For instance, people often check phones during dinner. Nevertheless, technology also bridges gaps. Ultimately, it depends on how we use it.
prompt: Write a short opinion paragraph: 'Is social media good for society?'

analysis.explanation: Formal way to introduce a common opinion (Passive Voice).
Nuanced way to agree partially.
Formal connector for contrast.
Strong connector for the final conclusion.

title: Structure: Abstract
modelText: This paper examines the impact of AI on education. Specifically, it addresses the shift in pedagogical paradigms. The findings suggest that while efficiency increases, critical thinking may decline. Thus, a balanced approach is advocated.
prompt: Write an abstract for a hypothetical paper on 'Remote Work'.

analysis.explanation: Academic standard for stating the subject.
Used to narrow down the focus.
Cautious and academic way to present results.
Passive voice is preferred in academic recommendations.
